title: Breaking news in East Yorkshire and North Lincolnshire - BBC News
summary: humberstone fitties residents challenge council over plan to sell chalet park .
more than one in 10 households in fuel poverty .
mental health services improving according to latest report .
british steel appoints new chief executive .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today , but we 're back from 08:00 on monday .
before i go , let 's have a look at five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
author: Folarin Sagaya
BBC Local Live, Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : peter with tonight 's headlines
text: watch the full stories on bbc one at 18:30 .
here 's peter with the headlines from bbc look north .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: cemetery 'circus ' performance to go ahead despite criticism
text: an aerial circus-like performance at hull 's general cemetery will go ahead in may as part of the city of culture events despite public opposition to the plans .
the show will feature acrobats above the audience and more than 100 singers from hull freedom chorus will be a part of the cast .
with performers also dressed as ghosts in the trees above the graves , it 's been described by some as disrespectful and insensitive .
the friends of general cemetery group have , however , welcomed the performance .

documents.title: councils at odds over new development in east riding
text: pocklington town council says it may try to overturn a decision to allow the building of retirement homes on george street near the town centre .
east riding council 's western area planning committee recently approved the building of the 55 flats by developer mccarthy and stone .
now the town council claims the east riding district authority did n't take into account the impact on the viability of pocklington town centre and says it may seek a judicial review .

documents.title: listen : mental health trust chief responds to improved cqc rating
text: the head of the humber nhs foundation trust says there 's still plenty of work to do in light of a new care quality commission report which says services have improved .
the cqc says it 's seen significant improvements in the trust following an unexpected inspection in december .
it comes just months after inspectors issued warning notices following concerns over secure wards , acute wards and psychiatric intensive care units .
michele moran says the trust is on the right path :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull city hall to host first tea dance in over two decades
text: the first afternoon tea dance at hull city hall for more than 20 years is due to take place next month after a member of the public requested it as part of city of culture .
about 250 people are set to enjoy a return of the traditional pastime with music from renowned blackpool tower organist john bowdler .
it 's proved so popular that a second event is being organised for may as the first has already sold out .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: why not match these mums ? # peoplescup
text: six months ago , many of these women were just watching their kids play .
now they are getting ready to play in the fa people 's cup
it 's not too late to enter this year 's fa people 's cup - the deadline to sign up is midnight on sunday .
entry is completely free , there are categories for everyone and you can enter either as a team or an individual player .
find out all the details here .

documents.title: football : imps aim for the 'impossible ' in fa cup
text: national league leaders lincoln city will aim to `` achieve the impossible '' against premier league side burnley in the fa cup fifth round .
the imps have reached the last 16 for the first time in 130 years .
victory on saturday would see them become the first non-league team to reach the quarter-finals since 1925 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: listen : hull mp responds to tony blair over brexit comments
text: hull west and hessle mp alan johnson says people should be given a say on the government 's final brexit deal .
the labour former home secretary was responding to tony blair 's comments earlier today in which he said the terms of the deal had not fully been understood before the referendum .

speaking at an event organised by the pro-europe group , open britain , mr blair urged people who voted remain the referendum to `` rise up '' and make it their mission to persuade supporters of brexit that they got it wrong .
he warned that the current prospects were for brexit `` at all costs '' , which could lead to a break-up of the uk .
the foreign secretary , boris johnson , has accused mr blair of insulting the intelligence of the electorate .

documents.title: watch : this evening 's weather
text: we 'll have variable amounts of cloud with a few clear spells , and where these occur , some mist or fog patches may form .
most parts dry but further light rain over western hills is possible with lows of 7c ( 45f ) .
here 's my forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: fleeing pet leaves owner foxed
text: a pocklington man is appealing for sightings of his rare pet which has gone missing .
charlie plumb 's asian fox ( or tanuki ) , called palesa , disappeared from her enclosure early on tuesday morning .
mr plumb says she looks a bit like a badger , but is quite tame .
he 's appealing for anyone who spots her to get in contact with him .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: do n't let gary down !
text: gary lineker is urging people to take part in the # peoplescup :
it 's not too late to enter this year 's fa people 's cup - the deadline to sign up is midnight on sunday .
entry is completely free , there are categories for everyone and you can enter either as a team or an individual player .
find out all the details here .

documents.title: trains to run until later during city of culture year
text: the train company transpennine express is to run a later train out of hull from may .
it 's hoped the 22:33 service to brough , selby , leeds and manchester will allow people to stay longer in the city at night , especially during city of culture year .
tpe also hope the new service will remain in place after 2017 , `` benefiting customers for years to come '' .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: hullywood icons on the humber bridge
text: we told you earlier about the hullywood icons city of culture exhibition which has its official opening this evening .
it features a series of people , including look north 's peter levy and the face of hull , kofi smiles , recreating iconic poses from films in locations around the city .
the organisers are displaying some of the images on the humber bridge , take a look at the video below :
'hullwood ' icons on the humber bridge

documents.title: spring is on the way
text: a welcome sign for some ?
snowdrops at elsham gardens and country park in north lincolnshire # spring # springiscoming # weather

documents.title: bus stop improvements in north east lincolnshire starting on monday
text: north east lincolnshire council will be starting work on a number of bus stop improvements from monday 20 february .
the locations affected are :
the upgrades will involve putting raised kerbs in place and a tactile crossing to improve accessibility and safety for bus passengers .
those bus stops will be closed during the works and the full programme is expected to be complete by 31 march 2017 .
visit the council website for the latest live travel information in the borough , including congestion and road works .

documents.title: weather this lunchtime
text: a mild afternoon with extensive cloud cover slowly tracking east .
this cloud will be thick enough at times to produce the odd spot of drizzle .
light winds and highs of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire & humber :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: fuel poverty can have adverse effects on childrens ' health
text: with one in ten households living in fuel poverty in our area , national energy action has been raising awareness of the impact it can have on children .
today is fuel poverty awareness day highlighting the fact over four million families across the country are unable to live in a warm , dry home .
peter smith is from national energy action :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: basil kirchin : making music from the voices of autistic children
text: maverick musician and pioneering composer basil kirchin recorded sounds he came across and then manipulated them - cutting , splicing , slowing down or stretching the tape to create new sonic oeuvres .

in an interview on bbc radio 3 's mixing it programme given in 2003 , kirchin explained to presenter mark russell how he came across the sounds including the voices of autistic children and a tram hurtling around a corner in switzerland .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: hornsea rescue gets life-saving camera
text: volunteers at hornsea inshore rescue are celebrating the arrival of their first thermal imaging camera .
they say they will use the camera at all times of the day and night as anything vaguely warm in the north sea will show up straight away , saving minutes in life and death rescue situations .
it was donated by chief fire officer , dene sanders on behalf of humberside fire and rescue .

documents.title: fancy seeing peter levy as james bond ?
text: the hullywood icons city of culture exhibition has its official opening this evening .
it features a series of people , including look north 's peter levy and the face of hull , kofi smiles , recreating iconic poses from films in locations around the city .
the exhibition is at the hip gallery in princes quay until april .
artist quentin budworth says the people of the city have been an inspiration :

documents.title: discontent over sale of chalet park rumbles on
text: questions are being asked of north east lincolnshire council about why it feels it must sell the humberston fitties .
last week councillors failed to make a decision on selling-off the chalet park that dates back to the first world war .
residents at the fitties , near cleethorpes , are worried about the future of the site if it 's sold to a leisure company and have put forward their own bid to run it .
the decision on the fitties ' future now goes to another committee at north east lincolnshire council .
this morning callers to radio humberside have been saying they want more transparency , but councillor matthew patrick says they 've been as open as they can be :
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: grimsby school launches unique partnership to get pupils into science
text: a grimsby school has joined forces with an education charity and a renewables firm to improve skills in science , maths and engineering .
ormiston south parade academy is taking part in a three year partnership launched by teach first .
it will also be working with dong energy .
the focus is to get children more interested in the so-called stem subjects .
paul drechsler is the chair of teach first :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: festival celebrating pioneering hull musician basil kirchin starts today
text: today 's the start of a weekend long festival celebrating the work of hull musician basil kirchin .

basil was a maverick musician and pioneering composer credited as a founding father of ambient music and is hailed by acts such as brian eno , st etienne and stereolab , yet he remains an obscure figure .
the festival aims to shine a light on a musician , regarded by many as a genius , who experimented with tape manipulation and found sounds .
'mind on the run : the basil kirchin story ' runs at the hull city hall until 19 february .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: british steel appoints new chief executive
text: british steel , which has its headquarters in scunthorpe , has announced the appointment of a new chief executive .
peter bernscher will take up the role in may and will work alongside the current chairman roland junck until the end of 2017 .
the company recently announced it had ended 2016 in profit and had taken on over 350 new employees since it was launched in june .

documents.title: listen : 'it 's a big challenge ' - council leader on meeting taxpayer demands
text: the leader of north lincolnshire council says tax payers will get value for money .
yesterday councillors voted to increase council tax bills by 3.99 % , which also includes the recommended government precept of 3 % which will be spent on adult social care .
the leader of the authority , rob waltham , has been speaking to radio humberside :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: services for mental health in yorkshire and humber getting better
text: mental health services in our region have improved .
that 's the finding of the latest care quality commission report into the humber nhs foundation trust .
here 's my report for radio humberside :
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: speed cameras on the humber bridge ? your reaction
text: here 's a story that 's been generating quite a big response .
we 've been asking if there should be fixed speed cameras on the humber bridge .
here 's what a few of you had to say :
never had a problem on the bridge , nobody ever flew past me driving dangerously .
how many accidents have happened to suggest that speed is an issue ? ''
is n't the humber bridge private ?
therefore surely , it 's up to the bridge board ``
first try the methods that cost less to install , perhaps ?
more signs warning of the speed limit , more paint on the road , and rumble strips that become annoying when you drive over them too fast .
these are options that could be tried to stop the behaviour rather than speed cameras that only penalise the behaviour when it happens ( and are a deterrent second ) . ''
the speed that some vehicles pass you is alarming therefore speed cameras would be a good idea .
as the bridge is privately owned not sure how this works legally , but could be another good income for the bridge or local authority . ''

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and the humber :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: one in 10 in our region too poor to stay warm
text: over one in ten households are living in fuel poverty in our area according to figures from national energy action .
today is fuel poverty awareness day and they say a lack of heat causes premature death across the country .
katie welsh from warmzone in hull says fuel poverty is n't rare in the city :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: eu says air pollution in hull is too high
text: pollution levels in hull have been declared unacceptable according to a report by the european union .
the a63 which runs through the city has been highlighted as the major cause for the problems .
hull city council says the rest of the city does not suffer from high pollution and it 's confident future road improvements will solve the issue .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : a cloudy but mild start
text: over the hills it will be a cloudy day with fog and some patchy drizzle .
further east cloud will break and it will be mostly dry with bright or sunny periods .
light winds and feeling mild with highs of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to today 's live feed across east yorkshire and the humber on friday 17 february 2017 .
i 'm folarin and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the area throughout the day until 18:00 .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Folarin Sagaya
BBC Local Live, Hull and East Yorkshire

text: that 's all from me today , but we 're back tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
your news , sport and weather updates will continue through the evening .
before i go , let 's have a look at five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
author: Folarin Sagaya
BBC Local Live, Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : this evening 's weather
text: a breezy evening with showers , which will die out overnight .
some clear spells developing in the east later .
temperatures dropping to 6c ( 43f ) but cooler in rural areas .
here 's my forecast :
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: hull council 's concerns adult social care funding
text: hull city council 's chief executive matt jukes has written to the secretary of state for communities and local government , sajid javid mp , about what he 's called a postcode lottery '' for adult social care funding .
# hull city council @ twitterid has written to sec of state @ twitterid expressing concern at changes to the way # adultsocialcare is funded
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: is it you ? £ 1m winning ticket unclaimed
text: the search is on for a missing lottery missing lottery millionaire from hull .
camelot , the national lottery operator , says the winning ticket was bought for the one-off team gb-inspired lotto draw on 27 august .
the winner has just a week to claim the prize , as the ticket expires on 23 february .
we 're eager to find hull 's mystery ticket holder and unite them with their winnings - this amazing prize could really make a huge difference to somebody 's life . ''
if the ticket is n't claimed before the deadline , then the prize money , plus all the interest it has generated , will go to help national lottery-funded projects across the uk .

documents.title: council approved £ 3.9m business centre
text: east riding council 's planning committee has given the go ahead for the development of a multi-million-pound business centre at the bridgehead business park in hessle .
the construction of the £ 3.9m project will be delivered by the council and once built , it will be operated in conjunction with the university of hull .
the centre will provide office space for the renewable and environmental technologies sector .

documents.title: have you seen this woman ?
text: thirty-six-year-old fiona fogarty ( also known by wyper ) of alliance avenue , hull , is missing .
humberside police say she did not return home after work yesterday and was reported missing by family at 23:25 .
fiona 's described as white around 5ft 4ins tall with a slim build and short dark brown hair , and was last seen wearing a grey woollen parker style coat with fur around the hood .
she is said to have taken her red hyundai i30 comfort with the registration number yy09 pluâ which was spotted in west yorkshire earlier today .
the police say they are seriously concerned for fiona ? s mental well-being and have asked anyone with information to get in touch quoting log 647 of 15/02/17 .

documents.title: north lincolnshire council tax rise approved
text: north lincolnshire council has confirmed an increase in council tax rates for the next year.â
it 's going to be increasing bills by 3.99 % , which also includes the recommended government precept of 3 % which will be spent on adult social care.â
it 's the first time in six years that council tax bills in the area have increased .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: reaction to city of culture cemetery circus
text: there 's been a very big response to the decision by the city of culture team to hold a circus-like performance at hull 's general cemetery .
the show , due to be held in may , is already sold out .
it will feature performers from the world renowned circus company circa , and 100 singers from hull freedom chorus .
here are just a few of the responses we 've received :
is there any wonder the majority of children have no respect nowadays ?
city of culture , maybe , but not showing any respect to the dead or their families at all does n't seem very cultural to me ! ''
i think that there are many places that this could be held rather than a cemetery .
have some respect !
# inappropriate ''

i agree with some of the comments but the people buried there were probably fun loving as well i agree that somewhere more appropriate would be good but then again it might do this particular cemetery some good as it so overgrown and derelict . ''

documents.title: cemetery circus performance 'abhorrent '
text: cemetery circus performance 'abhorrent '

documents.title: new colour scheme for east riding taxis
text: the first taxi to carry the east riding 's new official green and white livery will be unveiled in beverley today .
from 1 may , all new and replacement taxis will have to adhere to the colour scheme with green bonnets , roofs and tailgates and white doors .
the council says it will make sure the public can tell properly licensed taxis from other vehicles .
here 's my report :
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: breakinghull fined £ 20,000 for arsenal clashes
text: breakinghull fined £ 20,000 for arsenal clashes

documents.title: unlicenced anglers fined in grimsby
text: four people from grimsby have been fined for fishing without a licence .
they 're among a group of seven people fined thousands by the environment agency .
any angler over the age of twelve fishing on a river , canal or still water needs a rod licence .
last year in england , the environment agency prosecuted almost two thousand anglers for rod and line offences .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: weather this lunchtime
text: a rather blustery day , with a mixture of sunshine and variable amounts of cloud .
while the odd shower is possible , most places should stay dry .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and the humber :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: city of culture chief responds to cemetery circus concerns
text: the head of hull 's city of culture team has defended a decision to hold a circus-like performance at the city 's general cemetery .
martin green , the chief executive of hull 2017 , says they 've consulted community groups and the council .
we brought you the news yesterday that performers from the world renowned circus company circa are due to perform at the cemetery in may .
tickets for the show have already sold out and will see acrobats above the audience .
over 100 singers from hull freedom chorus will be a part of the cast .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: east riding council care initiative gets top marks
text: a scheme in the east riding that helps young people who have been in care is `` outstanding '' according to inspectors .
the care leavers programme helps 16 to 18-year-olds who have been in the care system make the transition to living as independent adults .
ofsted says the council makes tenacious efforts to keep in contact with the young adults involved .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: mixed reaction over city of culture circus plans at hull cemetery
text: there 's some outrage this morning to the plans to hold a circus in hull 's general cemetery as part of the city of culture celebrations .
we brought you the news yesterday that performers from the world renowned circus company circa are due to bring their production to the region in may .
well vivian has been on radio humberside and she thinks it 's in bad taste :
the show will feature acrobats above the audience and over 100 singers from hull freedom chorus will be a part of the cast .
tickets for the show have already sold out and mark ball , the artistic director of lift who have commissioned it says it will be respectful :

documents.title: listen : 'it 's hugely important ' - ukip mep on taking back control of uk waters
text: a local mep says uk waters and fish stocks must return to uk control after we leave the eu .
the guardian reported yesterday that they have obtained a document which states existing quotas of fish stocks will stay as they are - despite promises made by leave campaigners .
ukip fisheries spokesperson , mike hookem mep has been on radio humberside :
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: new visitor centre in north lincolnshire park gets approved
text: there 's to be a new visitor centre in one of north lincolnshire 's parks .
the council has given planning approval for the £ 350,000 centre at belton country park near scunthorpe .
it 'll include information boards about the local area and wildlife , a cafe and classroom .
permission was granted subject to conditions and work on the centre is expected to start in the spring , and is anticipated to take six or seven months to complete .

documents.title: mums in hull react to new smoking study
text: hull and north east lincolnshire have some of the highest incidences of pregnant smokers .
now there 's a new study from newcastle university which suggests that screening pregnant women for carbon monoxide can double the number of women who quit smoking in pregnancy .
here 's what mum 's in hull thought about the idea of being screened while pregnant :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: here 's a quick city of culture of guide for february
text: whether it 's half term activities or something for the grown ups , city of culture has events for everyone this month .
check out the video below for updates from face of hull 's very own kofi smiles :
wondering what 's on this week for the city of culture ?
wonder no more !
here 's @ twitterid with a brilliant guide

documents.title: passenger killed in grimsby collsion
text: a woman has died after the car she was in collided with a parked car transporter in grimsby , last night .
it happened at just before 21:25 on peaks lane .
the 29-year-old local woman , who was a passenger in the car was taken to the diana , princess of wales hospital , where she was pronounced dead .
the 50-year-old male driver , was taken to hull royal infirmary with leg injuries .

humberside police say they ca n't release either of their names yet but they want to speak to the occupants of a white seat and a black peugeot , which were parked close-by in the ymca car park shortly before the incident .

documents.title: family of murdered hull man welcome documentary
text: the family of anthony walgate who was poisoned by a serial killer hope a new documentary will shed light on the police investigation into the case .
stephen port was found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of 23-year-old mr. walgate from hull and three other men .
in this extract , anthony 's mum sarah talks about her son :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: scunthorpe kids can have a go at writing plays
text: a workshop is being held in scunthorpe today , designed to help young playwrights .
the theatre company box clever will talk about how to write plays for children and young people at the 20-21 visual arts centre .
it 's part of a project to get more drama teaching in schools .

documents.title: should there be fixed speed cameras on the humber bridge ?
text: drivers have signed a petition to say they want fixed speed cameras on the humber bridge .
we 'd really like to hear your thoughts on this .
do you think there should be cameras ?
let us know - get in touch by email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: study shows screening pregnant smokers cuts level of smoking
text: hull and north east lincolnshire are among the places with the highest number of pregnant women who smoke .
and a new report out this morning suggests if every mum-to-be is monitored for the effects of smoking , the number who do would fall by almost half .
newcastle university studied 40,000 women .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: kcom vans to feature famous faces from hull
text: the names of famous people from hull will soon adorn the vans belonging to the city 's phone provider .
kcom want to rename all of their 100 vans after famous hullensians , past and present .
the first will be lord prescott .
the firm 's marketing officer kathy phillips told radio humberside where the idea came from
author: BBC Radio Humberside

text: a pretty good start on the roads today in lincolnshire .
the only real issue to tell you about is temporary traffic lights near grantham on the a607 belton lane .
they 're slowing down traffic in the area so allow some extra time if you 're passing through .

highs of 10c ( 50f ) .

documents.title: scientist say new tech will allow for better prediction of storm surges
text: councils and the emergency services should be better prepared for tidal surges in future - thanks to a project that 's being launched by scientists this week .
researchers are using met office data and supercomputers to model the behaviour of storm surges , highlighting places where defences need to be raised and areas that are at high risk .
professor kevin horsborough from the national oceanography centre says severe tidal surges are rare so the aim is to generate more information on how they behave .
towns and villages along the humber estuary were affected by flooding as the highest tidal surge in 60 years passed along the coast in december 2013 .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : peter with tonight 's headlines
text: watch the full stories on bbc one at 18:30 .
@ peter levy with a preview of the 6.30 programme
peter you should ask lord porter why he 's spending 2.7 million on a face lift for council offices
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and the humber :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: 'what greater role models than us ? ' # peoplescup
text: meet the mums who decided not just to watch their daughters at football training but get involved on their own
there 's not long left to sign up for the fa people 's cup - the deadline is sunday , 19 february - and you can find out how to here .

documents.title: police issue cctv appeal following hull kr v salford pitch invasion
text: humberside police are asking for help in identifying 12 people connected with disorderly conduct following a rugby match between hull kr and salford last october .

there was a pitch invasion at the full time whistle on saturday 1 october 2016 involving supporters of both teams , during which a small number of fans are said to have been involved in violence and disorder .

the police says a number of people have already been arrested in connection with the incident and the officer heading the investigation says he wants to `` ensure all those involved are brought to justice '' .
i would urge those to get in touch with us as soon as possible or face the prospect of being arrested in front of family and friends at their home or work .
if members of the public think they can help identify those featured they should get in touch on 101 quoting crime reference number 2219563 . ''

documents.title: listen : 'disappointing ' - health chief 's reaction to latest rating
text: hospital services in hull and east yorkshire have been rated as `` requiring improvement '' by the care quality commission - the same rating it got in 2014 .
while some things have improved , there are a couple of areas where the trust falls short .
chris long is the chief executive at the hull and east yorkshire hospitals nhs trust :

documents.title: busy grimsby junction to get controversial traffic lights
text: the final decision has been made to have traffic lights installed at a busy junction near grimsby .
north east lincolnshire council 's cabinet has just approved traffic lights being put in at the tollbar roundabout .
it 's a controversial decision with some nearby residents and ward councillors fighting the plans .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: have you heard of basil kirchin ? do you know who he is ? no ?
text: perhaps it is because this maverick musician and pioneering composer lived in obscurity in a council house off hessle road for a large part of his life while he experimented with tape manipulation and recorded sounds .
or maybe it was because his music was considered radical and never received commercial success .
you may be surprised to learn kirchin is regarded as a founding father of ambient music and hailed by acts such as brian eno , st etienne and stereolab among others .
now a new festival in hull is shining a light on a man cited by many musicians as a genius .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: this evening 's weather : showers possible but should clear up tonight
text: patchy rain will clear the east coast this evening and the cloud will break up .
becoming breezier and a minimum temperature of 5c ( 41f ) .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : 'loan will pay for itself ' - north east lincolnshire councillor on borrowing
text: north east lincolnshire councillors are defending a proposal which could see the council take borrowing to a record high .
the council wants to borrow another £ 45m which it says will be invested to create new jobs and attract new business to the region .
if the plan is approved , it will take the councils debt to nearly £ 140m .
as government funding is cut councillor matthew patrick , the portfolio holder for finance , has moved to reassure residents that spending wo n't spiral out of control
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: report finds hull and east yorkshire hospitals trust requires improvement
text: hospital services in hull and east yorkshire have been rated as `` requiring improvement '' by the care quality commission , the same rating it got in 2014 .
some things have improved ; there 've been past issues with bullying , but the inspectors found a better staff culture .
also the report .
found staff treated patients in a caring way , rating that as good .
but it 's also found a shortage of nurses was evident and the trust still needed to meet national standards in a & e .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: does hull have a litter problem ?
text: residents on a hull estate say litter is making their lives a misery .
around eight tonnes of rubbish is up in the city everyday .
one councillor says cut-backs mean there are n't the resources to deal with a growing volume of rubbish .
we 're getting so many millions of pounds taken off us from the government that we ca n't deliver what we used to , because we have n't got the man-force . ''
author: Kate Sweeting
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: calls for sex education in schools to be made compulsory
text: it 's being claimed a lack of sex education in schools could create a `` ticking sexual health time bomb '' .
the local government association says if independent academy schools can choose not to give sex education classes then pupils will not be prepared for adulthood .
tish lamb works at cornerhouse in hull , where they work with young people to discuss sexual health .
she says it has the potential to be a big problem if children are n't given information .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: unemployment falls across yorkshire and northern lincolnshire
text: unemployment has fallen to its lowest level in more than a decade .
the number of people out of work at the end of last year was just under 1.6 million .
in the yorkshire and humber region , the number of people in work has increased to 2.58 million , that 's 65,000 more than last year .

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and the humber :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: listen : some hate crime rise 'linked to brexit '
text: a community safety manager for humberside police has been speaking about the rise in hate crime incidents in our area .
new figures show that the number of hate crime incidents in east yorkshire and north lincolnshire were at the highest on record during the three months after last year 's eu referendum .
the press association says that between july and september 2016 the number of recorded incidents were up over 50 percent on the previous quarter .
adil khan says after the referendum , they saw incidents which had clear connections with it , although they 're not pointing the finger at every leave voter .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather this lunchtime
text: after a murky and misty start with extensive mist there 's been some brighter spells .
but it 's likely to turn cloudy again in the late afternoon with some outbreaks of light rain .
light winds expected throughout the day with mild temperatures .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: teenager attacked in cleethorpes nightclub
text: a 19-year-old woman has been treated in hospital for facial injuries after being attacked by a man in the bootlegger club in cleethorpes .
it happened on the dance floor in the early hours of 22 january .
the man police are looking for is described as having short brown hair .
and wearing a black jumper over a checked shirt and blue jeans .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: volunteer group says lack of taxi information leading to drunken fights in beverley
text: beverley 's taxi ranks need to be better signposted to show people where to queue .
that 's according to the beverley street angels , who patrol the streets late at night helping and advising late night drinkers .
richard bradbury , from the street angels , says there have been a number of .
drunken disputes lately , often caused by disagreements over taxis .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: woman assaulted in cleethorpes nightclub
text: police in cleethorpes are asking if anyone saw a man assault a woman in one of the town 's nightclubs last month .
a 19-year-old woman says she was on the dancefloor at bootlegger when a man assaulted her around 02:00 on sunday 22 january .
the woman suffered facial injuries as a result and had to go to hospital .
the suspect had short brown hair and wore a black jumper over a checked shirt and blue jeans .

documents.title: big lottery grant for east yorkshire drugs charity
text: the big lottery fund is giving nearly £ 10,000 to an east yorkshire charity which warns young people of the dangers of so-called legal highs .
the real hull and east riding charity was originally set up in 2014 by experienced drug counselors .
it 'll use the money to run workshops warning young people against using the drugs .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: tickets for 'spell-binding ' city of culture circus show go on sale today
text: interested visitors can buy their tickets for depart , part of the roots and routes season of city of culture 2017 from today .
the show by world renowned circus company circa will feature performers from hull and will take place at the general cemetery in the city .
over 100 singers from hull freedom chorus will be a part of the cast , layering vocals onto the musical arrangement .
inspired by the legend of orpheus and eurydice , organisers say depart takes audiences on a path through the underworld in atmospheric locations .

depart embodies the whole ethos of hull 2017 : bringing world class artists to the city ; showcasing and developing local talent ; and using non-traditional venues to encourage people to look at parts of the city in a whole new light . ''
tickets for the show , which runs 18 to 21 may , are available from the hull 2017 website .

documents.title: scunthorpe gold
text: here 's a closer look at one of the gold figurines that will be hidden around scunthorpe this weekend .
artist @ twitterid with a solid gold fisher woman to be hidden by @ twitterid this w/end @ twitterid # treasuredcity # finderskeepers
hi amanda nice to see you in hull yesterday in the old town
you too , sorry i was in a rush .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: police appeal for witnesses after accident in scunthorpe
text: humberside police are asking for witnesses after an accident on the a1029 near scunthorpe on sunday .
a 46-year-old man was taken to hospital with serious injuries after his blue bmw left the road and hit a fence .
he 's currently in hull royal infirmary in a stable condition .
the accident happened at about 18:00 on sunday evening and police are asking anyone who saw what happened to get in touch

documents.title: listen : north east lincolnshire council could be about to borrow £ 45m
text: today , the cabinet will hear it needs the money over the next four years .
it would take the council 's debt to almost £ 140m .
here 's my report for radio humberside :
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: hunting for gold in scunthorpe
text: five gold objects originally worth £ 1,000 each have now arrived in scunthorpe , ready to be hidden and found from saturday .
clues to their whereabouts will be hidden in paintings at the 20-21 visual arts centre , its all part of a project called treasured city .
the objects are replicas of things found in the north lincolnshire museum , and if you find them you can keep them .

documents.title: tour de yorkshire roadshow in driffield today
text: a roadshow visits driffield today to tell businesses and people how they can make the most out of the tour de yorkshire .
the event visits the town for the first time in april .
the 2017 tour de yorkshire will start in bridlington and finish two days later in sheffield on sunday 30 april .
organisers say it generates around £ 60m for the county 's economy .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: listen : figures show hate crimes on the rise since brexit vote
text: humberside police dealt with a record number of hate crime incidents in the three months after the eu referendum .
new figures out this morning show the number of incidents was up by over 50 % on the previous quarter between july and september 2016 .
barbara perry is a councillor in north lincolnshire , she 's also worked with scunthorpe 's polish and eastern european communities for many years .
she says if the government 's attitude to immigrants does n't change , public attitudes will stay the same :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

they believe that in or around the 55th minute of saturday 's game against arsenal , the club failed to ensure that its players conducted themselves in an orderly fashion .

documents.title: six men arrested after scunthorpe arson attack
text: six men aged between 18 to 32-years-old have been arrested on fox street in scunthorpe as part of an arson investigation .

the operation was part of on-going enquiries into an arson attack on a property on frodingham road , scunthorpe ( at 22:25 on 8 february , which left a woman hospitalised with non-threatening injuries .

documents.title: basil kirchin : a beginner 's guide
text: basil kirchin : a beginner 's guide

documents.title: yorkshire paramedic struck off
text: a paramedic for the yorkshire ambulance service has been struck off following an investigation into allegations of misconduct .
a panel heard colin williams delayed giving chest compressions and defibrillation to a 79-year-old man who went into cardiac and respiratory arrest and died .
he later told the panel that he has taken early retirement and has `` no desire '' to continue practicing as a paramedic .
it is plain to the panel that , in view of all the factors in this case , any sanction other than that of a striking off order would be inappropriate .
to decide otherwise would be to place patients at risk of harm ``

documents.title: falling steel believed to have killed man in hull
text: a 46-year-old man has died after it 's believed he was struck by steel that fell from a van in hull .
humberside police and the health and safety executive are investigating the incident on vulcan street off clough road ( which happened yesterday afternoon .

documents.title: concerns over people disregarding bird flu rules in our region
text: people are deliberately ignoring rules to stop the spread of bird flu and putting millions of chickens and turkeys at risk in east yorkshire and lincolnshire .
that 's according to farmers , who want any evidence that birds are being allowed to roam outdoors to be handed to the authorities .
already thousands of birds have died after three outbreaks in the last few weeks .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: eu could stop east yorkshire fisherman catching sea bass
text: a group of fishermen on the holderness coast are hoping to persuade the eu to let them continue catching sea bass .
the fishermen , who set out long nets at low tide , say they 'll have to quit the business if the ban goes ahead .
but the international council for the exploration of the seas says sea bass populations around the uk are at dangerously low levels .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: police investigating after hull death
text: humberside police have told us they 're investigating following the death of a 46-year-old man at a business on vulcan street ( in hull yesterday .
the police say the coroner is aware and the health and safety executive has been informed .
at the moment it 's unclear how the man died .

documents.title: rare wwii raf clock recovered
text: a rare world war ii raf clock , which was stolen from hook village hall near goole , has been recovered .
the clock ( disappeared a couple of weeks ago and some anonymous calls led police to a 57-year-old hook man who has been questioned .
i want to thank those people who rang to provide us with the information that lead to the recovery of the clock .
this local information was invaluable and has meant that the clock can now be returned to the rightful owners . ''

documents.title: police appeal after baseball bat found in cleethorpes
text: during the early hours of saturday morning police were called to an area near the litehouse nightclub in cleethorpes ( after a man told ambulance staff he 'd been attacked .
the man has n't made an official complaint but a baseball bat was found in the area and police are now appealing for witnesses to what happened .

documents.title: sport : north lincolnshire 's guy martin to compete in tt race
text: guy martin and john mcguinness will race for the japanese-based mugen team in this year 's tt race for electric-powered machines .
martin will replace bruce anstey in the team , who won last year 's race .
martin , from kirmington , is still looking for his first tt victory , having finished on the podium 15 times .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: valentine warning over online romance fraud
text: four people from our region have been conned out of almost £ 30,000 after speaking to people they met online .
one goole man lost £ 23,520 , a second goole man lost £ 700 and a scunthorpe man lost £ 2,570 , after speaking to a woman who claimed to be a self-employed gold and diamond dealer .
in a fourth case , a grimsby woman was persuaded to hand over £ 2,000 to a man she formed a relationship with via social media who claimed to be an overseas doctor .
humberside police are now issuing advice to people on how to avoid being conned when dating online .

documents.title: hull city council to sell buildings housing small businesses
text: hull city council are planning to close and sell off some of their facilities used by small businesses .
they 're called managed workspace units and include places like the danish buildings , the lowgate centre , and hull microfirms centre .
in a statement , hull city council say they have n't given notice to tenants and do n't know when they will sell .
they added that they have written to all tenants about the potential sale and ask for anyone with concerns to contact their onsite teams .
hull city council will sell off the # microfirms centre on # wincolmlee .
gill runs lips embroidery : `` a move will sink my business . ''
@ twitterid @ twitterid 2mil to bring it up to scratch .
essential services should be safe guarded first , sorry but sell .

documents.title: man 'kicked and punched ' during robbery in hull
text: a 30-year-old hull man was robbed by a group of four men between 16:30 and 17:15 on 4 february on the boulevard near anlaby road (
the victim was approached by the group who tried to sell him a pay-as-you-go sim card .
he paid and tried to run away but he was grabbed and then kicked and punched before having his wallet and phone stolen .
police are appealing for witnesses .

text: albert kelly out for thursday :
hull fc can confirm albert kelly has submitted an egp and will miss next thursday 's game against @ twitterid

documents.title: have you seen this man ?
text: shane deakin is wanted on sus of conspiracy to commit burglaries across nottinghamshire , lincolnshire and derbyshire between 26 september and 9 november last year .
nottinghamshire police are advising members of the public not to approach the 28-year-old , of hemlock gardens , nottingham .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two drivers now in 'stable condition ' after crash which closed a165 for over six hours
text: a crash on the a165 near brandesburton yesterday afternoon left a 28-year-old man and 63-year-old man with serious injuries .
it happened at 14:00 and the a165 was closed until 20:45 while police investigated .
both men are now in a stable condition .
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: hull born actress and impressionist to return to city
text: hull 's debra stephenson ( will be returning home next month for city of culture .
her night of 100 voices show will see her mimic movie stars and tv personalities , as well as sing songs from some of her music idols .
the show will be performed at hull city hall as part of city of culture 's made in hull season .

documents.title: woman motorcyclist suffers 'very serious injuries ' in crash
text: a woman in her 50s has been taken to hospital in hull with what the police describe as `` very serious injuries '' .
she was on a motorbike which was involved in a collision with a ford focus at about 05:00 opposite the bp garage on leads road .
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: east yorkshire farmer struggling to recruit workers
text: a sprout farmer in east yorkshire says he 's having to automate part of his operation due to problems recruiting staff .

it comes as a report from the chartered institute of personnel and development says a growing number of sectors are experiencing the same problem , which may be down to fewer eu nationals coming here .

i think there 's been a lot of publicity about the uk leaving europe and if you do n't feel loved and needed in a country then you 're not going to go , whereas italy and germany and other countries are still attracting staff from eastern europe . ''
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: in beautiful morning
text: the sun is certainly out in beverley this morning .
choppy seas but still looks like it will be a beautiful day in hornsea .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: activities for people with parkinson 's and ms
text: new activity sessions for people with parkinson 's and ms have started in the east riding .
`` grin and tonic '' is the first scheme of its kind in the county .
the aim is to prevent people who are older or unwell , becoming socially isolated and keep them active .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: today 's weather
text: feeling less cold than the past few days , with higher temperatures and lighter southeasterly winds .
although probably cloudier than on monday , it should stay dry throughout with some hazy sunny spells , these more prevalent during the morning .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: council payout over half a million for substandard accomodation
text: since 2011 , hull city council has paid out over £ 500,000 in compensation to people who have lived in substandard accommodation .
the figures , from a freedom of information request by the bbc , show a total of £ 35m was paid out by all councils across the country .
hull city council told us their figure includes accidental damage to properties so it 's not fair for it to be compared to other local authorities .
they believe they 've received an increase in claims because tenants are being contacted by referral companies urging them to make claims .

both are causing queuing traffic .

documents.title: fine for 'farm waste ' trailer man
text: a horncastle man has been slapped with a £ 1,400 fine for displaying an advert on the side of a large lorry trailer without permission .
several requests were made to andrew riddel to remove the trailer from jubilee way in the town but he failed to comply .
east lindsey council eventually took him to court over the matter where he pleaded guilty and was ordered to pay the fine as well as costs of £ 765.34 and a victim surcharge of £ 140 .
the advert has now been removed .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: volunteers needed to make 'gigantic jersey ' for tour de yorkshire
text: if you 're handy with a needle and thread , then you might be able to help out the organisers of the tour de yorkshire .
they 're looking for people to help create a gigantic jersey for the event , which will stand 12 meters tall and be as wide as the length of a lorry .
the finished product will sit on the hillside overlooking the tour de yorkshire stage one finish in scarborough 's north bay on friday 28 april .
organisers want about 2,000 people of different ages and backgrounds to get involved in making the jersey which will then become a giant canvas for and messages .

documents.title: watch : how to help a child if they 're choking
text: ten days ago , 5 year-old theodore silvester died after choking during a dinner break at his school .
in the wake of his death , one first aid training company in hull says it 's had more enquiries than ever before .
trainer , sarah priday , explains how to help a child when they 're choking .
author: Jill Archbold
BBC Look North

documents.title: what are your untold stories of hull ?
text: from today , people in hull will be able to share their 'untold stories ' at libraries across the city .
it 's an initiative by yorkshire water as part of the city of culture year .
a video pod will tour four different libraries , with people encouraged to share their experiences of living in hull .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: floral tributes laid to james moorfoot
text: flowers have been left to james moorfoot on the football pitch in rudston where he died .
the 28 year-old was playing in a football match when he collapsed and died at the weekend .
friends say they 're `` numb with grief . ''
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: college criticised over £ 10m debt
text: hull college is criticised by the government after a report revealed it had £ 10m budget deficit .

documents.title: watch : guess the sci-fi film
text: kofi interviewed simon willmetts from university of hull about the digital dystopias festival , and tested his knowledge of some of the films they 're showing !
we 've given these films alternative taglines - can you guess what they are ?
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: in holy trinity renovation work underway
text: multi-million pound transformation works are underway at holy trinity church in hull .
the project will cost £ 4.5m .
work started today and here are some of the sent from the team .
from left , workmen mark salter , andrew martindale and andy thompson remove the first pew as part of the internal transformation of hull 's historic holy trinity church .
wood carvers andrew martindale , left , and andy thompson are part of the specialist team charged with preserving the heritage of the victorian pews at holy trinity church .

all the pews and decoratively carved pew ends are being carefully logged as part of the process of preserving holy trinity church 's victorian heritage while creating a new , flexible open space in the nave .

wood carvers , from left , ogninian ivanov , andy thompson and andrew martindale are dismantling pews at holy trinity church ready for remodelling at the workshops of bespoke architectural joiners houghtons of york .

documents.title: grimsby hit by icelandic fishing strike
text: grimsby hit by icelandic fishing strike

documents.title: mp challenges new fishing rules
text: a new eu regulation is threatening the livelihoods of holderness coast beach fishermen , according to the beverley and holderness mp graham stuart .
he 's written to the fisheries minister , george eustice , to ask him to pursue an exemption for holderness from a regulation which bans targeted sea bass fishing from the shore .
mr stuart says as the fishermen have a licence to continue to catch salmon and sea trout they will still catch sea bass in their net but will not be able to land them .
instead the dead bass will have to be thrown back into the sea , discarded on the beach or used as crab bait .

documents.title: hull college criticised over £ 10m debt
text: a report is questioning hull college 's strategy of job cuts to tackle its £ 10m deficit .
the government asked the further education ( fe ) commissioner to carry out an assessment of the college , after it asked for more funding .
hull college says they continue to respond to a challenging funding climate for the fe sector .
they go on to say that `` every student continues to have access to the outstanding teaching and support they need to complete their course successfully . ''

documents.title: picture : the view from owston ferry
text: a cold looking start in owston ferry .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: sport : grimsby town to make changes ahead of newport match
text: marcus bignot hints at grimsby town press conference that there will be changes for newport but says they were planned and not as result of defeat to crewe .
the grimsby town boss came out and apologised to travelling fans after they watched their side lose 5-0 at crewe in league two this weekend .
more than 740 mariners supporters had made the journey .
author: Simon Clark
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : windy with sunny spells this afternoon
text: remaining cold with some sunshine this afternoon .
some light rain possible .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : hunting for gold in scunthorpe
text: an artist is hiding gold statues in scunthorpe .
luke jerram has placed the mini-sculptures - each worth around a thousand pounds - for people to find , and keep .
keeley donovan has been out treasure hunting in the town .
author: Keeley Donovan
Inside Out

documents.title: watch : grimsby fish market affected by icelandic strikes
text: grimsby fish market is feeling the effects of a strike by icelandic fishermen .
some workers have been laid off and some restaurants are altering menus as only a tiny fraction of the market 's usual supply of cod arrives :
author: Leanne Brown
BBC Look North

documents.title: football death teacher 'coolest of cool '
text: football death teacher 'coolest of cool '

documents.title: more landlords buying properties in cash
text: the proportion of landlords paying for properties in cash has reached its highest levels in at least a decade .
january saw a 61 % of landlord purchases being made in cash across britain , the highest figure since records started in 2007 , according to lettings network countrywide .
landlords buying in the north of england , where houses are often less expensive , are the most likely to pay in cash , the report found .
some 70 % of landlord purchases in the north west of england are in cash , as are 68 % in yorkshire and the humber and 67 % in the north east .
on average landlords sell a home once every 17 years , meaning as prices have increased , a significant amount of wealth has built up in the sector .
this is now fuelling cash purchases .

documents.title: joe root `` will be respected as a leader ''
text: joe root `` will be respected as a leader ''

documents.title: watch : when your team loses 5-0 and the manager says 'sorry '
text: sorry does n't seem to be the hardest word to say for marcus bignot .
the grimsby town boss came out and apologised to travelling fans after they watched their side get beat 5-0 at crewe in league two this weekend .
more than 740 mariners supporters had made the journey .
the footage is courtesy of nigel lowther .
author: Simon Clark
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: a18 fatal crash victim named by police
text: a man who died in a road accident on the a18 near ludborough last wednesday has been named as daniel thomas , 33 , from healing near grimsby .
his family has released this statement :
he was a loving husband to nikki and a fantastic daddy and step-daddy to steph , lily , charlie and twins alfie and daisy .
dan was a family-orientated man who would do anything for his wife and children .
he will be greatly missed by everyone who knew him . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: stories making the news this lunchtime include :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: school community 'devastated ' at death of young teacher
text: james moorfoot died over the weekend during a football match near driffield .
the 28 year-old was an english teacher at hornsea school and language college .
pupils and staff say mr moorfoot was the 'coolest of the cool ' who you could always 'have banter with . '
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: scunthorpe steel used for new metro system
text: british steel has delivered 16km of rail for the latest phase in the tyne and wear metro system in north east england .
the works are part of a £ 350m improvement programme .
the rails were manufactured at british steel 's scunthorpe steelworks before being handed over to the contractor .
helping the uk and other countries develop and maintain rapid transit systems is a key objective of british steel .
this latest supply showcases new products which will increase rail life in service , giving significant capacity gains to the metro system .
author: Leanne Brown
BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingyorkshire 's joe root named as england captain
text: yorkshire batsman joe root has been named england 's test captain today .
root , 26 , from sheffield , succeeds alastair cook , who resigned after more than four years in charge last week .
no batsman has scored more than root 's 4,594 runs since he made his test debut in december 2012 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: lulu to perform in scunthorpe
text: lulu has confirmed she will perform at the baths hall in scunthorpe later this year .
tickets go on sale from 10:00 this friday .
she 'll perform at the venue on 17 november .
the scottish singer arrived on top of the pops in 1964 with her raucous , belting rendition of shout when she was just 15 years old .
she is the only female artist who has had a uk top 20 hit in every one of the last five decades .

documents.title: woman in hospital after car mounted pavement
text: a 19-year-old remains in hospital after a car mounted the pavement in hull over the weekend .
she 's being treated for serious but not life-threatening injuries .
two cars collided on beverley road at about 03:45 on saturday .
five people who were travelling in one of the cars were arrested at the scene .
they have been released pending further enquiries .

documents.title: flowers and footballs left in tribute to james moorfoot
text: flowers and footballs are being left in tribute to james moorfoot .
28 year-old james was an english teacher at hornsea school and language college .
he collapsed and died at the weekend while playing for langtoft afc in rudston near driffield .
friends and family say they 're `` numb with grief '' and that he died `` doing what he loved , in the village he loved , surrounded by the people who loved him . ''
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: childhood substance abuse increase
text: there 's been a big rise in the number of people reporting drug and alcohol misuse among children in yorkshire , new figures show .
the nspcc says the number of calls it 's received on the issue has risen by nearly a third in three years .
over that time , it says it 's taken about 2,500 calls from people with concerns in our region .
more than 920 people contacted the charity last year to describe potential substance misuse among adults when children and young people were in their care or nearby .
the figures have been released as the uk marks the start of children of alcoholics week .
author: David Ward
BBC Local Live

documents.title: church renovation work starts today
text: a multi-million pound renovation of hull 's most historic church starts today .
four and a half million pounds is being spent on transforming the interior of the holy trinity church .
it 's development trust says it 'll be the most significant upgrade since victorian times .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: countryfile winter diaries returns with keeley
text: keeley 's back for a new series of countryfile winter diaries this morning .
that 's from 09:15 on bbc one .
on bbc one at 9:15am - @ twitterid 's at boulby mine looking at the mining salt which keeps our roads safe
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : hull 2017 uk city of culture
text: what are your plans for next weekend ?
there 's a festival at hull city hall celebrating basil kirchin , hull 's best kept secret .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: some of the stories making the news so far :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: tributes paid to man who collapsed and died during football match
text: friends and fellow players have been paying tribute to a man who collapsed and died while playing in a football match in east yorkshire .
james moorfoot was playing for langtoft afc in rudston near driffield .
the yorkshire ambulance service said it was called to the incident on saturday afternoon , but attempts to revive him failed .
his club has released a statement say they are `` numb with grief ''
author: Gemma Dawson
BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : monday 's weather forecast
text: a cloudy and cold day ahead :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: a63 upgrade plans on display
text: it 's the final day of a consultation on plans to upgrade one of hull 's busiest roads .
the proposal includes lowering the a63 around the mytongate junction to allow a new bridge to carry traffic over the road , as well as two footbridges for pedestrians and cyclists .
if given the go ahead , highways england says it could take five years for works to be completed .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to local live for monday 13 february .
my name 's louise and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport and travel from across the area throughout the day .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are , by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Louise Wheeler
BBC Local Live
